intro: Dorstenia obovata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or woolly plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Dorstenia obovata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
